citing_paper_authors: Jonathan, Calder | Mike, Reape | Henk, Zeevat
raw_text: In this paper we present an algorithm for generating sentences using unification categorial grammars (UCGs, Zeevat et al 1987) but which extends to any categorial grammar with unification (e.g. ,categorial unification grammars, Uszkoreit 1986, Karttunen 1987)
clean_text: In this paper we present an algorithm for generating sentences using unification categorial grammars (UCGs, Zeevat et al 1987) but which extends to any categorial grammar with unification (e.g. categorial unification grammars, Uszkoreit 1986, Karttunen 1987).

raw_text: The lexical types are organised into an? inheritance hierarchy?, constrained by expressions of a simple feature based category description language, inspired by previous attempts to integrate categorial grammars and unification-based grammars ,e.g. Uszkoreit (1986) and Zeevat et al (1987)
clean_text: The lexical types are organised into an inheritance hierarchy, constrained by expressions of a simple feature based category description language, inspired by previous attempts to integrate categorial grammars and unification-based grammars, e.g. Uszkoreit (1986) and Zeevat et al (1987).

raw_text: Unificationbased versions of Categorial Grammar, known as CUG or UCG, have attracted considerable attention recently (see, for instance, Uszkoreit, 1986, Karttunen, 1986, Bouma, 1988, Bouma et al, 1988, and Calder et al, 1988)
clean_text: Unificationbased versions of Categorial Grammar, known as CUG or UCG, have attracted considerable attention recently (see, for instance, Uszkoreit, 1986, Karttunen, 1986, Bouma, 1988, Bouma et al, 1988, and Calder et al, 1988).

raw_text: Higher order versions of categorial grammars like the ones being produced in the CUG/UCG-frameworks ([Uszkoreit 1986], [Zeevat et at
clean_text: Higher order versions of categorial grammars like the ones being produced in the CUG/UCG-frameworks.

raw_text: The family of grammar models that are based on such formalisms include Generalized Phrase Structure Grammar (GPSG) [Gazdar et al 1985], Lexical Functional Grammar (LFG) [Bresnan 1982], Functional Unification Grammar (bUG) [Kay 1984], Head-Driven Phrase Structure Grammar (I-IPSG) [Pollard and Sag 1988], and Categorial Unification Grammar (CUG) [Karttunen 1986, Uszkoreit 1986, Zeevat et al 1987]
clean_text: The family of grammar models that are based on such formalisms include Generalized Phrase Structure Grammar (GPSG) [Gazdar et al 1985], Lexical Functional Grammar (LFG) [Bresnan 1982], Functional Unification Grammar (bUG) [Kay 1984], Head-Driven Phrase Structure Grammar (I-IPSG) [Pollard and Sag 1988], and Categorial Unification Grammar (CUG) [Karttunen 1986, Uszkoreit 1986, Zeevat et al 1987].

raw_text: Use of unification (a core operation in HPSG) in CG dates at least as far back as Karttunen (1986, 1989), Uszkoreit (1986), and Zeevat (1988)
clean_text: Use of unification (a core operation in HPSG) in CG dates at least as far back as Karttunen (1986, 1989), Uszkoreit (1986), and Zeevat (1988).
